item.title: David add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: David add a quote by Curtis Sittenfeld
item.description: "I always worried someone would notice me, and then when no one did, I felt lonely." -- Curtis Sittenfeld

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I talk about going to [George W. Bush's] Inauguration and crying when he took the oath, 'cause I was so afraid he was going to wreck the economy and muck up the drinking water'... the failure of my pessimistic imagination at that moment boggles my mind now." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: David add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Mr Bond, they have a saying in Chicago: 'Once is happenstance. Twice is coincidence. The third time it's enemy action'." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: David add a quote by Gracie Allen
item.description: "When I was born I was so surprised I didn't talk for a year and a half." -- Gracie Allen

item.title: David add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "In life you'll meet a lot of jerks. If they hurt you, tell yourself that it's because they're stupid. That will help keep you from reacting to their cruelty. Because there is nothing worse than bitterness and vengeance... Always keep your dignity and be true to yourself." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "There are two kinds of people in the world: the kind who alphabetize their record collections, and the kind who don't." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I have a similar affection for the parenthesis (but I always take most of my parentheses out, so as not to call undue attention to the glaring fact that I cannot think in complete sentences, that I think only in short fragments or long, run-on thought relays that the literati call stream of consciousness but I still like to think of as disdain for the finality of the period)." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Along with voting, jury duty, and paying taxes, goofing off is one of the central obligations of American citizenship." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Don't bring up McKinley. Don't bring up McKinley." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Like Lincoln, I would like to believe the ballot is stronger than the bullet. Then again, he said that before he got shot." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Buffy's high school was built on top of a vortex of evil, the Hellmouth. And whose wasn't?" -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "The modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top" -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: David add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: David add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: David add a quote by Francoise Sagan
item.description: "My love of pleasure seems to be the only consistent side of my character. Is it because I have not read enough?" -- Francoise Sagan

item.title: David add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: David add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: David add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: David add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles. If you know yourself but not the enemy, for every victory gained you will also suffer a defeat. If you know neither the enemy nor yourself, you will succumb in every battle." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: David add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win" -- Sun Tzu

item.title: David add a quote by Sun tzu
item.description: "All warfare is based on deception. Hence, when we are able to attack, we must seem unable; when using our forces, we must appear inactive; when we are near, we must make the enemy believe we are far away; when far away, we must make him believe we are near." -- Sun tzu

item.title: David add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Only the Dead stay seventeen forever." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: David add a quote by Thomas Geoghegan
item.description: "That's my point: if you own thirty or more books, or you are reading any book at this moment, you may protest all you want, but you were born on the wrong continent." -- Thomas Geoghegan

item.title: David add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: David add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "two people can sleep in the same bed and still be alone when they close their eyes" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: David add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm not so weird to me." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: David add a quote by Elna Baker
item.description: "I think crush is the perfect word to describe it, too, because it simultaneously means 'to have a brief infatuation with someone unattainable' and 'to be violently squashed." -- Elna Baker
